channel.title: Hacker News - English
channel.description: Hacker News articles summarized and translated to English

item.title: Munich's surfers left stunned after famed river wave vanishes
item.description:
‘We’re at a loss’: surfers have been ruing the loss of the Eisbach wave after a recent cleanup. Photograph: Leonhard Simon/ReutersView image in fullscreen‘We’re at a loss’: surfers have been ruing the loss of the Eisbach wave after a recent cleanup. The Eisbach wave was originally believed to be formed by gravel, but the Munich surfing community later installed wooden planks that helped artificially stabilise the wave.

Read more

item.title: Direct File won't happen in 2026, IRS tells states
item.description:
IRS The IRS has notified states that offered the free, government tax filing service known as Direct File in 2025 that the program won’t be available next filing season. Still, most of the taxpayers that used Direct File earlier this year — over 296,500 — gave it high marks. , told Nextgov/FCW that "the fight isn't over," saying that "giant tax prep companies are popping champagne, while Americans are forced to spend more time and more money to file their taxes.

Read more

item.title: Zohran Mamdani wins the New York mayoral race
item.description:
Zohran Mamdani projected to win New York City mayoral race03:11Get more newsLiveonNov. The two had heated debates in recent weeks, with Cuomo calling Mamdani a “divisive force in New York” while Mamdani painted Cuomo as Trump’s “puppet. Interestingly, exit polling showed self-identified Republicans favored Cuomo over Sliwa, with 61% of Republicans him while just 35% backed Sliwa.

Read more

item.title: Building blobd: single-machine object store with sub-ms reads and 15 GB/s upload
item.description:
In terms of design trade offs, the object store would prioritize reads over writes. Without needing this, would it be possible to design an alternate simple object store and achieve constant low latency. Each object would have metadata ("inode") and data: the data would be the actual value, while its inode would contain its key, size, version, heap address, etc.

Read more

item.title: What Happened to Piracy? Copyright Enforcement Fades as AI Giants Rise
item.description:
Since the mid-nineties, software giants led by Microsoft have waged a global war against copyright infringement and online piracy. That is because it is now the tech giants that are accused of exploiting pirated content on an industrial scale. The AI giants have all but admitted that they have developed their most advanced models by tapping into mass piracy.

Read more
